name: WIN'ARD SABOT
notes:
Loosely based on Charles MacGregor's SABOT as published in Rudder magazine in 1939. (originally the Balboa Dinghy). (The small, pram type dinghy is said to have originated in Norway.)
Similar to the NAPLES SABOT but with a daggerboard. Once raced as a class on the west coast US during the 1970's, it's popularity has not persisted to the extent of some other similar designs like the OPTIMIST.
